intro: Crepis willdenowii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Crepis willdenowii is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these habitats.
